name: Agent Teams Guide
description: How to coordinate multiple Claude agents working as a team
content:
Agent Teams let you coordinate multiple Claude instances working together. One session acts as team lead, coordinating work and assigning tasks. Teammates work independently and communicate directly.

Key concepts:
- Team Lead: Creates team, spawns teammates, coordinates work
- Teammates: Separate instances that work on assigned tasks
- Task List: Shared work items that teammates claim and complete
- Messaging: Direct communication between agents

Best for: Research & review, new features, debugging with competing hypotheses, cross-layer coordination.

name: Sub-agents Guide
description: Create specialized AI subagents for task-specific workflows
content:
Subagents are specialized assistants that handle specific types of tasks. Each runs in its own context window with custom system prompt and tool access.

Built-in subagents:
- Explore: Fast, read-only codebase search (Haiku)
- Plan: Research agent for planning mode
- General-purpose: Complex multi-step tasks

Benefits: Preserve context, enforce constraints, reuse configs, specialize behavior, control costs with cheaper models.

name: Workspace Management
description: How to organize and manage workspaces effectively
content:
Workspaces help you organize different projects and conversations. Each workspace has its own:
- Chat history and session
- System prompt configuration
- Active agents, skills, and guides
- Model selection

Tips:
- Create separate workspaces for different projects
- Configure relevant agents for each workspace
- Use system prompts to set context
- Clear chat to start fresh conversations

name: Prompt Engineering Guide
description: Write effective prompts for Claude AI
content:
Effective prompting techniques:

1. Be specific and clear about what you want
2. Provide context and constraints
3. Use examples (few-shot prompting)
4. Break complex tasks into steps
5. Specify output format
6. Use system prompts for persistent behavior

Advanced techniques:
- Chain of thought: Ask Claude to think step by step
- Role assignment: Give Claude a specific persona
- Structured output: Request JSON, markdown tables, etc.

name: Local Storage with DuckDB
description: How your data is stored locally and securely
content:
sangyi-tui uses DuckDB WASM for local-only data storage. All your data stays in your browser.

How it works:
- DuckDB WASM runs entirely in your browser
- Data is persisted to IndexedDB automatically
- No server-side storage of conversations
- Each workspace has isolated data

Tables: workspaces, messages, agents, skills, guides, workspace_config, memory

To clear all data: Clear your browser's IndexedDB for this site.

name: Claude Model Comparison
description: Compare Claude models: Opus, Sonnet, Haiku
content:
Available Claude models:

Opus (claude-opus-4-6):
- Most capable, deep reasoning
- Best for complex analysis, architecture
- Cost: $15/$75 per million tokens

Sonnet (claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929):
- Balanced performance and cost
- Great for coding, writing, analysis
- Cost: $3/$15 per million tokens

Haiku (claude-haiku-4-5-20251001):
- Fastest, most affordable
- Good for simple tasks, search, validation
- Cost: $1/$5 per million tokens
